corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

abstract.value: This collection contains the papers of union organizer and Communist Party member Sylvia Hall Thompson (1924-2012). Thompson's papers primarily consists of Freedom of Information Act release files related to Federal Bureau of Investigation surveillance of Hall throughout the 1950s and 1960s. The collection also contains a small portion of material related to Sylvia's first huband Samuel Hall as well as material related to her second husband Robert George Thompson and the Thompson v. McNamara case.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Sylvia Hall Thompson Papers; TAM 639; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown. The accession numbers associated with this collection are 1950.142 and 2013.047.

In subsequent years, Sylvia became a mainstay in the New York office of the Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade, working with veterans and organizing the annual reunions. Sylvia Thompson passed away in 2012.

This collection contains the papers of union organizer and Communist Party member Sylvia Hall Thompson. The majority of this collection relates to Sylvia's efforts to have her second husband Robert George Thompson interred in Arlington National Cemetery. A large portion of the collection also consists of Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) FBI Files on Sylvia Hall Thompson. See Series level scope and contents notes for further descriptions.

dsc.value:
Series I: Samuel Hall and Robert George Thompson MaterialsScope and Content Note

Series I contains a small portion of material related to Sylvia's first husband Samuel Hall such as a marriage certificate, photographs, Sylvia Hall Thompson's reminisces of her husband, and clippings related to Hall's activism and his death in 1954. Material related to Robert Thompson includes a marriage certificate, correspondence, and photographs.This series also contains several articles by Robert Thompson, which were published in Political Affairs and materials related to Sylvia Hall Thompson's involvement with the Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade.

McNamara and Robert Thompson letter to Chairman of Soviet War Veteran's Committee1965, 196719Letters from Robert Thompson to Sylvia Thompson1958-1962110Series II: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) FBI FIles on Sylvia ThompsonScope and Content Note

Series II primarily consists of Freedom of Information Act release files related to Federal Bureau of Investigation surveillance of Hall throughout the 1950s and 1960s. Thompson requested copies of these files in the 1980s. Correspondence between Thompson and various government agencies is also included. Additionally, this series contains one cassette tape titled "Nuchow interview" and an encased coin commemorating the 50th anniversary of the Antifascist Spanish War.

McNamara Trial MaterialsScope and Content Note

Series III "Thompson v. McNamara" contains materials related to Sylvia Thompson's efforts to have her late husband interred in Arlington National Cemetery. It includes court documents exhibits and briefs, press clippings, photographs and correspondence. Also included is "The Arlington Case: Robert Thompson-story of an unburied soldier," which is a pamphlet published by Sylvia Thompson in 1967 in an effort to publicize her attempts at interring her husband in Arlington National Cemetery.
